com.lukeleber.scandroid.sae.j1979

Interface ServiceFacet

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<ServiceFacet>, Internationalized, android.os.Parcelable, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    PID<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPID, AbstractServiceFacet, DefaultPID

    public interface ServiceFacet
extends java.lang.Comparable<ServiceFacet>, java.io.Serializable, android.os.Parcelable, Internationalized
    The ultimate base class for all PIDs, TIDs, OBDMIDs, and INFOTYPEs defined by SAE J1979. All PID/TID/OBDMID/INFOTYPE objects are stateless objects that simply define the request format, bit/scaling algorithm(s), and response formatting.
    See Also:
    Comparable, Serializable, Parcelable, Internationalized

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface android.os.Parcelable

    • Method Detail

      • getID

        int getID()
        Retrieves the unique ISO/SAE/Manufacturer defined identification number of this ServiceFacet
        Returns:
        the unique ISO/SAE/Manufacturer defined identification number of this ServiceFacet

      • getDisplayName

        java.lang.String getDisplayName()
        Retrieves the ISO/SAE/Manufacturer specified display name of this ServiceFacet. It can be assumed that this string may be displayed to the user in a GUI. There exists an option to retrieve a more user-friendly version of the display name through the use of Internationalized.toI18NString(android.content.Context).
        Returns:
        the ISO/SAE/Manufacturer specified display name of this ServiceFacet

      • getDescription

        java.lang.String getDescription()

        Retrieves a brief description of this ServiceFacet. Note - descriptions are not explicitly required to be displayed to users, and may not use the wording of the standard in verbatim. This method can be thought of as a non-standard extension of J1979 that can be safely ignored if strict compatibility is required.

        That being said, I felt that the descriptions should be available so that if users want to gain a deeper understanding of onboard diagnostics, the information would be available in a "non-standardese" dialect. "Standardese" is hard enough for implementers to understand sometimes, let alone end-users!

        Returns:
        a brief description of this ServiceFacet
